businessProfile.name: Station 34
businessProfile.address: 34 S Main St, Mt Prospect, IL 60056, USA
businessProfile.formatted_address: 34 S Main St, Mt Prospect, IL 60056, USA

reviews.text: Food was decent! Got the buffalo chicken wrap and it tasted extremely fresh, but the star was the mound of fries that were heavy enough to feed 2! They were a bit busy and the server a bit inattentive and the atmosphere is just another sports bar. However we will be back to try the pizza at which time I'll edit this review.

This is currently my favorite local pizza place. I always get the ‚ÄòDetroit Style‚Äô pepperoni. It‚Äôs so good. They have a great beer selection and a ton of TVs for sports and I‚Äôve even gone here for a UFC event. The place can get loud when there is a live band. If you sit upstairs it isn‚Äôt as bad, but still pretty loud so be prepared. It doesn‚Äôt bother me, but if someone in your group is sensitive to sound just be aware of that. Parking can be a pain at times. Pro tip is park across the street, on the street, by the bakery.

Tim and Vince run the bar like champs and are why we come here.  Entertaining and great laughs all around.  Also Troy is positive energy that is contagious.   Great atmosphere, food, and service.  Explains why sometimes tough to get a seat at the bar as they are in demand!

It‚Äôs alright but nothing special. $12 Mac and cheese portion is really small and tastes like box Mac and cheese. No dipping sauces with calamari and no red pepper flakes and Parmesan as requested.  Detroit style tasted decent.

I recently discovered Station34 and tried their takeout, which was phenomenal! It's hard to find takeout that's as good as dining in, but this place nailed it. My favorite is the Southwest Veggie Pizza on tavern crust‚Äîit's so flavorful with the Southwest sauce and cheesy goodness.

I also tried their cheese curds, which were amazing as an appetizer. However, I wasn't a fan of their Taco Pizza; the salsa Verde paste didn't quite work with the pizza. They also had a rotating special, the Mac & Cheese, in January, which was a miss for me. The pasta was very overcooked and lacked flavor.

It can get busy, so I recommend making a reservation if possible; otherwise, they do take walk-ins. Overall, Station34 is a great spot for tasty takeout and a lively game-day atmosphere.

editorial_summary.overview: A menu of house-made pizzas & bar fare in a space with modern, industrial interiors & high ceilings.

recentReviews.text: It was a busy night, but our waitress did wonderful. Food was good. Drinks were good. The bartender accommodated us for what we wanted. That‚Äôs worth a try.
Excellent thin crust pizza üçï The atmosphere is fun an full of energy.
The cocktails were pretty good and strong. The service was excellent. Only the live music was too loud and we couldn‚Äôt hear each other.
Low on staff but it was a Thursday lunch drop in so expected a little bit quicker service. Some of us have to go back to the office. Lol.

detailedReviews.author: Donna Krueger
detailedReviews.text: It was a busy night, but our waitress did wonderful. Food was good. Drinks were good. The bartender accommodated us for what we wanted. That‚Äôs worth a try.

detailedReviews.author: Scott Schmaren
detailedReviews.text: Excellent thin crust pizza üçï The atmosphere is fun an full of energy.

detailedReviews.author: Tatiana Avdjiev
detailedReviews.text: The cocktails were pretty good and strong. The service was excellent. Only the live music was too loud and we couldn‚Äôt hear each other.

detailedReviews.author: Vee H
detailedReviews.text: Low on staff but it was a Thursday lunch drop in so expected a little bit quicker service. Some of us have to go back to the office. Lol.

detailedReviews.author: Anna Packowitz
detailedReviews.text: I hate to give such a low rating but we had a horrible experience here recently and tried to reach out to the restaurant manager TWICE with ZERO reply. We came here with a large group and had probably the worst service ever. We got here at 5 and didn't leave until after 8 because our server kept forgetting to put in our food order. We also had small children with us so for them to have to try to sit this long made it a miserable experience for all of us. Our server kept disappearing and was no where to be found. Overall TERRIBLE experience and the management here needs to do better to follow up with their customers!!!!!

detailedReviews.author: Valerie Lendzion
detailedReviews.text: Great place to listen to live music, attentive & friendly staff...good nachos & Detroit style pizza

detailedReviews.author: Rose Giarratana Cantilena
detailedReviews.text: If you're looking for a good glass of Wine, Don't go here

detailedReviews.author: Chirag Maru
detailedReviews.text: Good food options with a really nice selection of Beers on tap!

detailedReviews.author: Jon C
detailedReviews.text:
Very good food and large portions.
If you are into alot of noise at casual restaurant, this is the place for you!
Pretty cool old two story brick firestation!

detailedReviews.author: Stuart Genovese
detailedReviews.text: I just discovered this gem recently.  So much fun. The food , the atmosphere, the service.  Brittini, my bartender , is especially awesome.  So nice and so knowledgeable. Love this place , already been back twice this week. !! ‚ù§Ô∏è

detailedReviews.author: Chris Brody
detailedReviews.text: Great food, great service, great atmosphere!

detailedReviews.author: Dave Dunn
detailedReviews.text: I give the food a 3 star rating, because anything with bacon on it has gristle, rubbery pieces in it, which is a turn-off for me. A little more attention in the food prep could remedy this. Also, the live music is a bit too loud, due to the acoustics of the venue, and should be turned down a notch. Otherwise, it's a great place with good food and atmosphere in general, although the bartenders could be a little more attentive.

detailedReviews.author: Jamey Johnsen
detailedReviews.text: This is currently my favorite local pizza place. I always get the ‚ÄòDetroit Style‚Äô pepperoni. It‚Äôs so good. They have a great beer selection and a ton of TVs for sports and I‚Äôve even gone here for a UFC event. The place can get loud when there is a live band. If you sit upstairs it isn‚Äôt as bad, but still pretty loud so be prepared. It doesn‚Äôt bother me, but if someone in your group is sensitive to sound just be aware of that. Parking can be a pain at times. Pro tip is park across the street, on the street, by the bakery.

detailedReviews.author: Mark Carlson
detailedReviews.text: Station 34 always has a nice variety of local draft beer and food specials.  Staff is great too!

detailedReviews.author: Grant
detailedReviews.text: First of all our server was incredibly attentive and I really appreciate that.  Station 34 has many unique pizzas on their menu and I tried 2 of the Detroit style ones. They were both pretty good and I would recommend anyone in the area try them.

detailedReviews.author: Kristie Brettman
detailedReviews.text: Stopped in on a Saturday for lunch.  So glad we did.  Food was great and the service was wonderful. Meals in our group included the shrimp tacos, beet salad, Cuban sandwich and  a classic burger.  Everyone thoroughly enjoyed their food.  Would definitely return.

detailedReviews.author: JPJ Company
detailedReviews.text: Great vibe.... Detroit style pizza is great

detailedReviews.author: Hamed Mirzamani
detailedReviews.text: Sometimes the food is great, sometimes it‚Äôs eh. We are neighbors and would still recommend.

detailedReviews.author: Tom Chmielinski
detailedReviews.text:
Ordered the Detroit style pizza. Sauce, cheese and toppings were pretty tasty.

I‚Äôve had over 20 different Detroit style pizzas, including in Detroit. Other than the carmelized crust, this is, in no way, shape or form, Detroit style pizza. The crust is flat and dense, not fluffy and the bottom should be crunchy and this was soft.

That disappointment aside, I will try different styles next time. They shouldn‚Äôt call it Detroit style.  The toppings and sauce have me hope to try again.

detailedReviews.author: Karen Hinchcliffe
detailedReviews.text:
Went to hear live music. Only seats available were upstairs not in sight of the band.
No parking offered.

detailedReviews.author: Jonathan Small
detailedReviews.text: Tim and Vince run the bar like champs and are why we come here.  Entertaining and great laughs all around.  Also Troy is positive energy that is contagious.   Great atmosphere, food, and service.  Explains why sometimes tough to get a seat at the bar as they are in demand!

detailedReviews.author: Critical Reviews
detailedReviews.text: Food was decent! Got the buffalo chicken wrap and it tasted extremely fresh, but the star was the mound of fries that were heavy enough to feed 2! They were a bit busy and the server a bit inattentive and the atmosphere is just another sports bar. However we will be back to try the pizza at which time I'll edit this review.

detailedReviews.author: Mike Murdza
detailedReviews.text: It‚Äôs alright but nothing special. $12 Mac and cheese portion is really small and tastes like box Mac and cheese. No dipping sauces with calamari and no red pepper flakes and Parmesan as requested.  Detroit style tasted decent.

detailedReviews.author: Ian Blewett
detailedReviews.text: Friendly server, buffalo wings are good size and delicious.

detailedReviews.author: Katie Grublesky
detailedReviews.text: Our waitress worked her butt off!  It was a packed night because The B-Side Band was playing.  The food was good, hot, and plentiful.

detailedReviews.author: John Bajkowski
detailedReviews.text: Consistently good pizza (fan of Detroit style served here), apps, and handhelds at fair prices. Frequently have live music which is fun, but can be a bit chaotic on the main level during a show. Second story offers a more relaxed environment if desired. Miss the booths where they now offer video gambling, but that just seems inevitable nowadays. Small, but pleasant outdoor patio during summer.

detailedReviews.author: John Ward
detailedReviews.text: Great food.  Excellent gluten free pizza.  Friendly staff!

detailedReviews.author: Mark Goode
detailedReviews.text: The beer nuggets are amazing! Plus Hop Butcher on tap! üòé

detailedReviews.author: Scott Parmelee
detailedReviews.text: Great food, great beer

detailedReviews.author: Hillary
detailedReviews.text: Amazing place with the best food. Staff is attentive and engaging. The owner is in the mix and interactive. I can't say enough about this place. It's a vibe ‚ù§Ô∏è GO.

detailedReviews.author: John Lucio
detailedReviews.text: Ordered the Detroit style pepperoni with fresh Mozarella and honey, well!! The Fresh Mozarella was whipped cream or maybe Canoli cream, I called and complain about it, and they said they used shredded Mozarella so to lies in a row!!! Will see we live in town we may try again,  maybe not!!

detailedReviews.author: Mark Sohn
detailedReviews.text: Would recommend reserving a table during holiday season.

detailedReviews.author: Gene Bazan
detailedReviews.text: Pizza was decent.  Don't know about $23 worth.  1) 8oz(?) draft beer was $7.75!  No more going for a beer while I wait for my pizza.

detailedReviews.author: Mitchell Gordon
detailedReviews.text:
One of the best spots in downtown Mt Prospect!
Diverse menu that worked with my wife around her food allergies. Detroit pizza was great and there were offerings for gluten free bread. Nice beer tap menu and great staff!
Definitely a spot to revisit.

detailedReviews.author: Kimberly Gordon
detailedReviews.text:
I am a gluten free, shellfish free, tree nut free and peanut free gal. There are so many food options and they are so accommodating. Their french fries are fried in the same oil as the shrimp and they offered to pan fry or bake the fries or tots. I have never had any restaurant be that accommodating. ü©∑

Also, Julia, one of the bartenders is so nice! I asked her questions because of all of my allergies and she suggested so many options üòä. She also makes a KILLER espresso martini!

12/10 place to go

detailedReviews.author: Mark Heffernan
detailedReviews.text: Phenomenal place known for their great pizza and sports bar atmosphere. Have watched the Bears lose here several times ü§£

detailedReviews.author: Ed Pawelko
detailedReviews.text:
I recently returned to Mt Prospect and was hoping to find a good place to watch the Bears game as I'm sadly still a fan.  Unfortunately, this place doesn't know how to work the audio system so it's impossible to hear the the game at all.  For a sports bar, their screens are also sub-standard.

On a positive note, I was pleasantly surprised with several of their beer selections and thought the BLT sliders were amazing.

I may return for a few good beers & live music but would never recommend Station 34 for a sporting event.  Cheers.

detailedReviews.author: Christopher Escobar
detailedReviews.text: Awesome staff, great beer selection, and legit pizza.

detailedReviews.author: Matthew Slaughter
detailedReviews.text: The jalape√±os cream cheese pizza and cheese curds  were delicious! We ordered online and picked it up. The restaurant was nice, clean and waitstaff friendly.

detailedReviews.author: John Landwehr
detailedReviews.text: Great crowd good food good service and half-price Pizza on Wednesdays. Thin crust very good

detailedReviews.author: Jonathan Flores
detailedReviews.text: We were looking for a bite to eat after church and decided to head into Mount Prospect to try something new. Pizza was on our mind, so this seemed like the place to try. We grabbed some seats at the bar and enjoyed our evening. Vincent was very friendly and attentive. The pizza was so-so, there was something lacking but couldn't quite put our finger on it. Overall its a great neighborhood place to watch a game and grab a beer.

detailedReviews.author: Tita Gold-Read
detailedReviews.text: Great food and staff!

detailedReviews.author: Ulysses Cardenas
detailedReviews.text: Amanda was very calm and patient. She made sure our bill was super quick and easy to handle with some complicated splitting. Food was amazingly good and I couldn't find what not to order. The live band made the night and our group didn't want to leave. Definitely telling everyone about this place. Parking is limited but only cause this place is worth it

detailedReviews.author: Holly Downs
detailedReviews.text: Their Detroit style pizza is a must try dish. The place has a very cozy and fun atmosphere.

detailedReviews.author: Mary Eck
detailedReviews.text: Very good service, great pizza üëç

detailedReviews.author: Doina P
detailedReviews.text: We gave Station 34 one star because the food was horrible. We ordered a small Detroit pan pizza with four toppings. Our pizza only had three of the four toppings for which we paid. Our order was quoted to take 20 minutes, but actually took an hour. If you like a five pounds solid brick of bread with some cheese you might enjoy this place. Otherwise do yourself a favor and go mostly anywhere else.

detailedReviews.author: Anne Rohwedder
detailedReviews.text: My first time calling in to order a pizza for delivery. They directed me to place my order online. Pizza came in incorrectly eventhough I wrote how I wanted it under their "special instructions", they refused to make it right and actually argued with me,  It's shocking that they do not care. They are willing to lose a new customer over their cost of a pizza. Which by the way is very salty! How disappointing! Never again!!!! If you want to support an establishment that doesn't care for it's patrons then go there. Ugh!

detailedReviews.author: Dominic Calamari
detailedReviews.text: Dope environment, fire food, Go Bears!

detailedReviews.author: Tracie Gibson
detailedReviews.text:
I did Grubhub for this meal. The Caesar salad and the Detroit style pizza was delicious!!

The only thing I wish they would have included was utensils.

detailedReviews.author: Knilb D
detailedReviews.text:

detailedReviews.author: Jon Desmond
detailedReviews.text: I ordered carryout and the food was ready on time.  This was the worst poke bowl I‚Äôve ever had. No sauce of any kind. No edamame.  No flavor. I‚Äôm not expecting a lot getting a poke bowl from a bar, but this bowl made the ones from the grocery store look like they were from a 5 star restaurant and it was double the price after convenience fee and a small tip for carryout service. Do not get the poke bowl under any circumstances.

detailedReviews.author: Sandra Mika
detailedReviews.text: We have hosted 2 parties here and had an absolutely fantastic experience both times! We did the pizza bar for one and the VIP buffet for the other- I highly recommend them as the food is delicious and the service is awesome as well. The Italian beef is so freaking delicious. I wish we lived in their delivery area because we would order all of the time!

detailedReviews.author: Mitchell Swiatek
detailedReviews.text: The food is great.  Ther service not so much.  I was afraid to order more, because the service lacked attention.  The burgers & wings tasted fresh, I never thought of adding whipped Rica cheese to the Brussel Sprouts.  Delicious.  Definitely a place to stop if you wants good food.

detailedReviews.author: Joseph Burger
detailedReviews.text: The food and service here is always exceptional

detailedReviews.author: Carole Hrametz
detailedReviews.text: Get together with old friends,food & atmosphere was good. Needed a bigger table for 6.

detailedReviews.author: Jeff Dietz
detailedReviews.text: Waitresses are young and stupid draft.Beer $9 food Less than expected. The guy sitting next to me at the bar found a hair in his food that was enough for me.  I'm gone‚úåÔ∏è

detailedReviews.author: Vladislav Gichev
detailedReviews.text:
This place is a very good spor bar, if not the best in the area. The room is spacious with a nice view from the second floor. The food is decent, nothing fancy but good burgers and other meals (you should try the Angus beef minies). The beer list used not to be updated regularly, but I have to admit the last two months there are new good additions like Ninja vs Unicorn and Laser Snake.
The servise is something that they could work on and improve cause it seems that the staff is inexperienced, but if you are lucky and Tiffany is in your area, then you wont have any problems.
Overall, the bar gives you great experience when watching games of the Chicago teams while the place still not very noisy, so people could comfortably talk. In times when there are no games I would assume that this bar is a nice place to have a drink and chat.
2024 Update. Station 34 is still a very good place to go either by watching a sports game, testing a new beer, or just to hang out with friends. They updated their menu, it has many draft beers, they even have a special deal with Hop Butcher. The chef specials are amazing, so if you have been there in 2024, you will be pleasantly surprised.

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers have positive experiences overall. Your 4.4/5 rating from 100 recent reviews shows solid satisfaction with room for growth.

strengthsPerceived: Customers love the excellent thin crust pizza and Detroit style pizza, making it a favorite local pizza place. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
The atmosphere is fun, full of energy, and enhanced by live music, making it a great place for entertainment. - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility
The attentive and friendly staff, including knowledgeable bartenders like Brittini, provide excellent service that keeps customers returning. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
improvementOpportunities: Negative reviews and lack of management response to customer complaints - review management can address this concern
Inconsistent food quality and misrepresentation of menu items (e.g., Detroit style pizza) - social media marketing can improve this area
Long wait times and slow service during busy periods - Boostly marketing services can improve this

positive.author: Donna Krueger
positive.text: It was a busy night, but our waitress did wonderful. Food was good. Drinks were good. The bartender accommodated us for what we wanted. That‚Äôs worth a try.

positive.author: Scott Schmaren
positive.text: Excellent thin crust pizza üçï The atmosphere is fun an full of energy.

neutral.author: Tom Chmielinski
neutral.text:
Ordered the Detroit style pizza. Sauce, cheese and toppings were pretty tasty.

I‚Äôve had over 20 different Detroit style pizzas, including in Detroit. Other than the carmelized crust, this is, in no way, shape or form, Detroit style pizza. The crust is flat and dense, not fluffy and the bottom should be crunchy and this was soft.

That disappointment aside, I will try different styles next time. They shouldn‚Äôt call it Detroit style.  The toppings and sauce have me hope to try again.

negative.author: Anna Packowitz
negative.text: I hate to give such a low rating but we had a horrible experience here recently and tried to reach out to the restaurant manager TWICE with ZERO reply. We came here with a large group and had probably the worst service ever. We got here at 5 and didn't leave until after 8 because our server kept forgetting to put in our food order. We also had small children with us so for them to have to try to sit this long made it a miserable experience for all of us. Our server kept disappearing and was no where to be found. Overall TERRIBLE experience and the management here needs to do better to follow up with their customers!!!!!

negative.author: Rose Giarratana Cantilena
negative.text: If you're looking for a good glass of Wine, Don't go here

negative.author: Mike Murdza
negative.text: It‚Äôs alright but nothing special. $12 Mac and cheese portion is really small and tastes like box Mac and cheese. No dipping sauces with calamari and no red pepper flakes and Parmesan as requested.  Detroit style tasted decent.

recommendations.title: Generate More Reviews
recommendations.description: Encourage satisfied customers to leave reviews
